summary.para: Allows content protection systems to access the protected environment.

param.name: inputLength
param.para: The length in bytes of the input data.

param.name: input
param.para: A pointer to the input data.

param.name: outputLength
param.para: The length in bytes of the output data.

param.name: output
param.para: A pointer to the output data.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

remarks.para: See for an example of how to create an object and use the Call method.

param.name: outputLength
param.para: The length of the data returned in output.

param.name: output
param.para: Receives the contents of the global revocation list file.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Allows reading of the system Global Revocation List (GRL).

summary.para: Provides a method that allows content protection systems to perform a handshake with the protected environment. This is needed because the CreateFile and DeviceIoControl APIs are not available to Windows Store apps.

remarks.para: See for an example of how to create and use an IMFProtectedEnvironmentAccess object.
